fullText: Who lip-synced the national anthem at the Super Bowl? Who had the longest performance? Who messed up the lyrics? Find out here before your Super Bowl party. Lauren Scala finds out how you can win a trip to Palm Coast, Florida. No Pur. Nec. Void where prohibited. 21+ Ends 2/1. Subject to Official Rules. NBC’s Super Bowl LX pregame show in the Bay Area will feature Alcatraz Island, the first ever live broadcast to take place there. Inspired by a homework assignment in her social studies class, Connecticut student Eniola Taiwo pushed for the LAFD to be honored on the Walk of Fame. “Southern Charm” star Shep Rose sits down with Lauren Scala to chat about the Craig-Austen drama, dating, and the benefits of ayahuasca. Paula Pell, Kapil Talkwalkar, & Julia Duffy chat with Lauren Scala about the new dark comedy “The ‘Burbs.” Here are our biggest takeaways from the 68th Grammy Awards. Bad Bunny makes Grammy Awards history with win for album of the year for Spanish-language ‘Debí Tirar Más Fotos’. During his monologue, Trevor Noah joked about Nicki Minaj meeting and praising Donald Trump at the White House. “Melania: Twenty Days to History” brought in $7 million, according to Amazon MGM Studios, which distributed the film. Bad Bunny joined dozens of other artists at the Grammys in criticizing immigration operations across the country. The Grammy is designed for artists who achieve “a breakthrough into the public consciousness.” “Monday I lost the love of my life. My Codi,” Cori Broadus wrote Saturday on Instagram. President Trump said Sunday he will move to close Washington’s Kennedy Center performing arts venue for two years starting in July for construction. The biggest names in music came out Sunday night for the 68th Annual Grammy Awards in Los Angeles. The competition was fierce at music’s biggest night. See the full list of artists who won big at the Grammy Awards. Connor Storrie will host the Feb. 28 episode of “Saturday Night Live” with musical guest Mumford & Sons. Russian fans of “Heated Rivalry” could end up in prison if they display their love for the show, but the gay romance is a hit anyway. The 68th annual Grammy Awards will take place Sunday with a dramatically different tone than last year.

dtliExcerpt: Don’t be fooled by the title of Disney’s latest film-to-stage transfer. Aladdin may be named after its lead street urchin character, but the musical comedy that just opened at the New Amsterdam Theatre is all about one character: the Genie. That’s due to the casting of the energetic James Monroe Iglehart, who all but erases the memory of Robin Williams, the voice of the Genie in the 1992 animated film. It’s rare that you see an actor playing a character he was born to play in a career-defining performance. Iglehart, last seen on Broadway in Memphis, uses his background in improv to create a comedic and charismatic Genie, who’s equal parts Fats Waller, Luther Vandross and Oprah Winfrey (“You get a wish! You get a wish!”).
